Iâ€™ve noticed a lot of the reviews on the App Store are based on everyoneâ€™s personal experience with GOAT purchases after the fact and their costumer service. However Iâ€™d like to review the App itself, the UI, and the design. Starting with the App itself, I freakin love it. The idea behind buying and selling shoes easily on 1 platform is what has caused the attraction to this app. I will say I have experienced my fair share of issues as well... (app crashes, issues loading/reloading results, erasing shoe â€œwantsâ€ù list) overall though, pretty impressed; nothing crazy. As far as the UI and design, I do like the simplicity of its interface and how easy it is to find, purchase, and/or sell sneakers.  A couple of my gripes come from my experience when browsing or searching for sneakers. Iâ€™ve noticed when I search for a specific sneaker and click on a shoe, the keyboard pops up every time I return to my original search results. Very annoying for browsing/shopping. I have to dismiss the keyboard before I continue scrolling. Not sure if itâ€™s intentional or not because it happens every time you search for something, but I canâ€™t understand the reasoning behind it. Second issue is with the filter feature and its options. Why on earth is there not a filter for price anywhere on this app? Makes no sense to me to have one for something as specific as color but not price; to me price is a more important criteria even before you get to color. THIS ABSOLUTELY NEEDS TO BE ADDED IN THE NEXT UPDATE. Will make browsing and searching for sneakers so much easier and faster. WIN-WIN! In addition to that, sorting features for price should be added as well. If Iâ€™m browsing through the main page for sneakers, maybe I donâ€™t want to see all the ones that cost $300+ a pair all the time. Sometimes I wanna see the cheaper sneakers! Being able to sort the page by price will allow me to do that. Simple modification that will make this app 10X better. Thanks for reading this long review. Hopefully some of the Developers from GOAT catch this and make a change or two. Sincerely,Happy GOAT Customer

A lot of people in these comments don't seem to realize but it's a resale service, it's slow. Should've known that when you signed up. That being said, when it takes 2 weeks for shoes to go from the seller to the verification center that's also a problem. Of the shoes I've bought I've had mostly good results. 2 perfectly smooth transactions and 1 which I had to return due to a discoloration. They offered a full refund however it still would've been nice to never get a pair of damaged shoes in the first place.Regarding the new update, when going through the searched shoes you cannot hide the keyboard, taking up half the screen and really annoying. It also seems like it wiped a lot of listings. There was a shoe I was looking at (to replace the ones I returned once I got refunded) which was available in every size and now all listings are completely gone. The only feature I would like would be to contact sellers selling damaged items. If it says "new with markings" it's not always easy to see where or how bad the markings are.

I ordered a pair of Yeezy Belugas from GOAT and waited 4 days to get an update on the shoes. They said that theyâ€™re trying to reach the seller and, if they canâ€™t, they will try to find me another pair. Finally on the 5th day I got a notification that the shoes were on their way to GOAT for authentication. Finally on the 10th day when I emailed them about the shoes, they told me the seller bailed on the sale. Their policy is to notify you after 72 hours as to whether or not the transaction would come to fruition. However, after those 10 days when I got a refund I tried to look for another pair, but the market had moved up $100. I told them that they broke policy but they are avoiding answering my question or admitting guilt and because of them I had to pay more for the same shoes. I told them I could have bought them for $10 more after 72 hours because they were still listed on GOAT and StockX for a decent price. But after 10 days the price went up a lot. When I question them about it they avoid answering. They straight up keep telling me they gave me a refund. I inquired about this 5 times and each time they avoid answering my question as to why they were negligent and just respond with, the amount has been refunded to your account. Extremely unprofessional. Be aware when purchasing.

This is a very secure way to buy and sell sneakers. I am in the process of registering to sell and I have already bought a pair. There are always great deals and the app is very secure. They do not give out your personal information and they have a top-level verification system to make sure you are never buying fake sneakers. You can't ask the seller questions, something they could improve on, and the app is occasionally buggy on older devices like my 5s. I highly recommend this app, and I hope it will continue to improve.
